website_summaries.verdict: We like the sturdy, 2-point design of this economical bike hook that folds away between uses.
pros: The minimalist design of this wall hook is attractive to those looking to save space
Folds up out of the way when not using
Hook can be installed at a slight angle to accommodate sloping top bars or kids’ bikes
cons: Mounting screws tend to strip easily

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, crappy screws. Nice rack otherwise.
customer_reviews.text: Do yourself a favor and get better screws before installing. As I was hand tightening the screw into the stud, the screw became stripped. If a screw becomes stripped from only using my hands, it shows the cheap quality of hardware they send. So go get better screws before mounting. Otherwise, the rack is fine and holds the bike.
customer_reviews.author: Vice Lujan

customer_reviews.title: Simple and functional
customer_reviews.text: These went up in a flash and I think they have upgraded the screws as they were steel not aluminum and thick/long. After a bit of maneuvering I figured out how to hang them vertically so that none of us have to lift our bike over another and so far they seem great.
customer_reviews.author: JBMumsy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: These are so perfect and great and they save a lot of space for you by using the wall instead of occupying space that you could use for something else and very reasonable price. I got 3 of them. And they came with their own screws. I've been hanging the bike for a month now and they are reliable.
customer_reviews.author: El-Maz

customer_reviews.title: This rack works just fine. There were some complaints from other users about ...
customer_reviews.text: This rack works just fine. There were some complaints from other users about the mounting screws. If you drill a 5/32" pilot hole and use the CORRECTsize phillips screwdriver (#3) the hardware is fine. I suspect others were using a smaller phillips, which will strip any screw head.
customer_reviews.author: wem3

customer_reviews.title: Be ware of the screws!
customer_reviews.text: Good rack, horrible hardware. DONOT use the screws provided. They will strip the moment you start drilling.
customer_reviews.author: OzzieJ

customer_reviews.title: Good, easy product
customer_reviews.text: I like simplistic products that do the job it is supposed to do and this bike rack does well. I installed this in my shed and it holds up well. The only issue I had was getting the screw in the stud. I stripped it and had to swap it out for another screw but I think that was me and not the product. But I definitely recommend. The photos look like the bike is on the ground but it isn’t. It’s just the angle.
customer_reviews.author: LeighA

customer_reviews.title: Great Horizontal Hanging of Bike
customer_reviews.text: This is a sturdy hanger that screws into a stud. The arms that cradle your bike are padded and the design puts the arms far enough from the wall to accommodate the handlebars and keep the bike straight. I like having my bike just slightly off the ground in a horizontal position. The hangers that hang the bike vertically are too difficult for me to remove my bike and most have your bike jutting out into your space. I plan to purchase two more for additional bike mounting.
customer_reviews.author: SashaBear

customer_reviews.title: Junk!
customer_reviews.text: This product is terrible. Wish I had seen the reviews talking about the junk screws! Despite drilling proper pilot hole size and using correct screw head, it stripped out. Tried to use vice grip to get out, but wouldnt budge. Only way was to tighten it. Now its permanently there. Real crappy product in terms of durability too, seems to bend with my light weight hybrid mountain bike which is obviously not 50 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Needs more top screw holes and screws
customer_reviews.text: To mount on an interior wall (not in your garage), you'll need a stud detector. There are 2 screws and 2 screw holes, but the pull out tension on top screw is at about 100 pounds considering that the bicycle is several inches from the wall and the wall plate is only about 3 high. One can drill more holes near the top of the wall plate and install more screws (I didn't have time) to improve the sturdiness of the installation, but it seems to be holding according to person who is using the bicycle hanger.
customer_reviews.author: Rich R

customer_reviews.title: Flips up but doesn't stay up. What's the point ...
customer_reviews.text: Flips up but doesn't stay up. What's the point of flipping up if it won't stay up? Had to mount above head level. Otherwise seems simple, functional and should hold up with an expected little sag over time
customer_reviews.author: Joseph C Williams IV

customer_reviews.title: Great Product / Cheap Screws
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and strong hanger. Find the stud, pre-drill the holes and what happens? The cheap import screwheads strip out as soon as you start the drill driver. The screws are like halfway in the wall and I had to hacksaw the heads off to get the hanger free. Hammer, patch and putty. What a nuisance. If you buy these, make sure you have a couple of good deck screws or similar, Made In USA, so you can mount it securely. Now you know why imported steel is so much cheaper than USA Steel.
customer_reviews.author: BMC

customer_reviews.title: Don't use the included screws
customer_reviews.text: Works great for a large men's beach cruiser. From other reviews I threw out the included screws because I didn't want to get "screwed" if I ended up stripping them due to the cheap quality. Bought 2 1/2" screws from home depot and they worked great. Make sure you screw into a wooden stud
customer_reviews.author: Mark S

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Wall Hook
customer_reviews.text: I ordered and installed the 2 bike hooks. Sturdy and good materials and construction. Holds the bikes off the wall nicely. My only complaint are the lousy aluminum screws they send with the hook. Like many others the heads stripped about halfway in, even after I drilled some pilot holes. . Had to run to hardware store to get good steel screws to mount hooks. if you order get #12 x 2" steel screws to mount.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Lousy Quality Control
customer_reviews.text: The rack itself is fine. What was hugely irritating is one of the attachment screws was defective: no indentation on screw head, so totally useless. I should gave checked screws before beginning installation because I drilled starter holes for rack in wall stud, and only that size screw is now usable. Have to make specific trip to hardware store to replace.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Fast and simple way to get bikes up and save space
customer_reviews.text: I prefer to keep my bikes on separate racks to avoid unnecessary scratches and having to decide which bike goes first, etc. so these are my favorite solution. Bar hook is a nice depth so no concerns about it falling off. I do recommend using studs for mounting, although some sheet rock anchors are rated well beyond 50lb. Note that in the photo that bike is a junior teen-sized girl’s bike, thus the funky angle, but this size works for my full size adult bikes as well.
customer_reviews.author: eagle364

customer_reviews.title: Works/looks great.
customer_reviews.text: This bike rack works great (I bought 2), but as other users stated, you must do the following during installation: 1. Drill 5/32 pilot holes. 2. Use the correct size screwdriver bit. Even when following the above instructions, I still slightly stripped the screw while drilling, but it is still removable.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Decent, but the screws...
customer_reviews.text: Value for the money is good, but it is by no means real sturdy. The arms flex a bit when the bike is placed on it, but it will hold the bike just fine. But those screws provided are made from the softest metal I've ever seen. As others have complained, I made sure to pre-drill the screw holes to relieve the stress on the screw and I still managed to strip the phillips head before the screw tightened on the mount. Replace those screws and your rating will go up.
customer_reviews.author: Frank D.

customer_reviews.title: Serves its purpose, could be sturdier.
customer_reviews.text: The product does what it’s intended to. The included screws were cheap and did strip. I had to purchase separate screws to use for installation. The bars could be a bit sturdier, but they are holding the bike fine. Will update if anything changes.
customer_reviews.author: Otter

customer_reviews.title: Bad screws, good rack.
customer_reviews.text: Great rack, but USE YOUR OWN MOUNTING SCREWS. One of mine came in with an incorrectly made head and the other stripped USING A SCREWDRIVER. These screws are made of butter. Spend the $0.75 at Home Depot and get your own screws. Rack itself works great, is sturdy once installed, and hold my bike just fine (XL Road bike).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Screwed by the screws
customer_reviews.text: Like the rack and should be simple to install. However, after drilling to create a hole in the wall stud, the screws stripped when I tried to hand screw them in. I was able to put the lower one all the way, but left some space on the top screw because it was so stripped. In retrospect, I would have bought better screws before installing. A 10 minute job took 30 minutes and not to my satisfaction... Note to manufacturer: Put in better screws and charge us 0.50 more
customer_reviews.author: Peter E Shin

customer_reviews.title: Holds bike!
customer_reviews.text: Does what it supposed to do. After reading reviews I decided not to bother with using the screws that came with the product, instead I used deck screws. Found the studs and done.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Trahan

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy wall mount, awful included screws.
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I bought these wall mounts to get our road bikes off the floor of the garage. They work just fine after we went out and bought screws at the hardware store. The included screws are absolutely terrible and stripped almost immediately when we tried to use them. I recommend throwing them away right off the bat and going and getting something nicer.
customer_reviews.author: Kale Hotpants

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this wall mount
customer_reviews.text: Happy with this wall mount. My bike is relatively heavy, but this mount vastly secured to the center of a wooden stud has proven more than up to task.
customer_reviews.author: K Healy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, but wobbly
customer_reviews.text: For my purpose of getting bikes onto the wall, these are fine. I had now issues with hardware. My biggest problem is they wobble when you bump them. They probably wont break, but I would rather have a rigid design that does not flip up (since my bike is on it most of the time anyway).
customer_reviews.author: Dan Bungert

customer_reviews.title: The arms are way to long
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what bike they think folks are putting on this thing. The arms are so long that it sticks your bike way out away from the wall. I have ended up pushing by bike back on the non padded part to not have it sticking out into the room.
customer_reviews.author: M. David Miller

customer_reviews.title: Simple, effective bick rack
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 of these in the garage and would have more if I had more space for them. Easy to install, and works fine for bikes of all weights, sizes, and shapes.
customer_reviews.author: inside the granfalloon

customer_reviews.title: Holds heavy beach cruisers well. Screws are fine.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, included screws worked fine despite the negative press in these reviews. Holds some heavy steel-framed beach cruisers. Only negative so far is that when folded up, they dont stay in place but rather fall right back down.
customer_reviews.author: M. Gunn

customer_reviews.title: Sketchy on drywall. Use sturdier screws.
customer_reviews.text: The rack itself is made of good solid material but the mounting screws that come with it are a waste of time. Get better screws and you have a great wall mount.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Vasquez

customer_reviews.title: Economical wall mounted bike rack
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to hang bicycle frames from wall above shop area. Works well for intended purpose and seems sturdy enough to hold a complete bike. Good price, would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Sean McGonegal

customer_reviews.title: Good rack, soft screws
customer_reviews.text: The rack itself is great quality and easy to hang. But the screws it comes with are really soft - I stripped the heads of two of them trying to get them in the wall. I’d recommend this rack but use your own screws.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Best value and strongest quality.
customer_reviews.text: High quality. and keeps your bike off the wall. The screws could be better quality but that’s a easy fix. Sturdy as ever too.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: You’ll have a winner if you ...
customer_reviews.text: Replace stock screws by GRK 2.5” fasteners you have a winning hanger Like : overall design, material and finish. Dislike : fasteners Wall suspension for bike.
customer_reviews.author: Bengal

customer_reviews.title: good but one issue
customer_reviews.text: This wall mount for bikes is well designed and strong enough to hold almost any bike. One issue is the screws. They are long enough but the metal is too soft. I used the correct Phillips head but the screw head just turns to mush. Stripped way too easy.
customer_reviews.author: Jneg

customer_reviews.title: Hardware screws are junk
customer_reviews.text: Too bad, the unit is great and easy to install. Pad protects the bike paint. Would have given it a high rating except for the cheap screws. I am talking junk. I even drilled pilot holes. Head of screw turns to mush instantly. Buy some screws at the hardware store.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice rack, lousy hardware
customer_reviews.text: Rack feels good. Sturdy. Included hardware (screws) were cheap and stripped in seconds. When I swapped in some hardware I had in the house installation sped along. Skip the included hardware and you'll be fine.
customer_reviews.author: AI

customer_reviews.title: Holds bike well, but makes me nervous how spongee ...
customer_reviews.text: Holds bike well, but makes me nervous how spongee it is special being placed above my limited production car. I added two additional holes in backing plate as reinsurance.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Discard the supplied screws and get #12 x 2” metal screws and you’re good
customer_reviews.text: I followed the advice of other reviewers and got metal screws from Menard, drilled pilot holes and had 3 Trek bikes (24” kids and 820 WSD on the wall in the garage in 15minutes. Works for girls bike as you can in the pictures. It’s very sturdy a
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Screws!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know how this bike rack is because I couldn’t install it without stripping the screws it came with. What I’m saying is, this product comes with cheap screws so be ready to either have a half installed bike rack you can’t get rid of or a fully installed bike rack you can’t get rid of.
customer_reviews.author: SauceofGods

customer_reviews.title: Good rack but terrible screws
customer_reviews.text: Good bike rack but was very disappointed with the screws that came with it. They stripped within the second time of us trying to put them in. Thankfully we had other screws that were big enough for us to use.
customer_reviews.author: Puryear

customer_reviews.title: quick ship and decent quality.
customer_reviews.text: Good concept for bike storage. Only concern has been lifting bike onto hangar. For very lightweight bikes shouldn't be a problem but as one gets older lifting becomes more difficult,
customer_reviews.author: ep

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Easy to install, but if you're screwiing it into a plaster wall make sure it's going into a stud. (Bikes are heavy). I would definitely order again.
customer_reviews.author: Grant E. Warrens

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Came as expected and without issue and i was able to install it and it is currently holding my wifes steel frame without issue or bending. No issues with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Orser

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: As others say, highly recommend getting better install screws from hardware store. Works amazing though!
customer_reviews.author: M3party

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Bike Holder !!!!
customer_reviews.text: What I like about the bike holder. It’s very easy to put up. The screws that come with the bike holder. They are very bad qualities screws . You will have to get better screws.
customer_reviews.author: roberttwalls

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be very well built. I think it's a good value.
customer_reviews.text: I'm impressed with the build quality of this. I wanted it to mount a bicycle on the back of our travel trailer. Time will tell whether it holds up, but I'm confident it will.
customer_reviews.author: Utah Pete

customer_reviews.title: Cheap screws
customer_reviews.text: Cheap screws. Strip out in seconds. Use a better quality screw. You can see the nice hole it left in my wall thanks to the screws getting stripped out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My bikes look like art
customer_reviews.text: These are the best value/quality/easy install bike hooks on Amazon. Literally put one up in less than 2 mins. They hang both my 8 pound and 18 pound bikes, and they look like pieces of art on the walls! I love that they are very sleek, and you can hardly see them on the walls. I get compliments on them every time someone comes over!
customer_reviews.author: Jordyn

customer_reviews.title: Great for hanging bikes
customer_reviews.text: The Stalwart 75-ST6016 is well made and easily holds my bike securely. Even looks good for a utilitarian bike rack hook.
customer_reviews.author: GW

customer_reviews.title: Great- but make sure your bike supports its style
customer_reviews.text: Works amazing, but only if you bike has a bar to attach to. (See my photo) ordered two, but ended up returning 1 because of having no way to hang the second bike.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great, easy install. Not the sturdiest thing ever but does the job no problem
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Get better screws
customer_reviews.text: The product looks like it’ll work fine but the screws stripped before the were even half way in
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good bike rack
customer_reviews.text: Works for what it’s designed to do. Just put it up, time will tell if it holds up over time. We installed in a stud to make sure it has a firm hold.
customer_reviews.author: ken

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT use screws supplied !!
customer_reviews.text: Looks good had to put anchors and use REAL steel screws not the cheap aluminum screws supplied.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Guzman

customer_reviews.title: Fasten to wall studs and you're good to go!
customer_reviews.text: Very secure when fastened to wall studs in garage. I like that you can fold it up out of the way when not in use so people don't accidentally walk into it.
customer_reviews.author: John Doe

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good
customer_reviews.text: Simple to install but could be just a little for sturdy. seems a little flimsy
customer_reviews.author: Deeznutts

customer_reviews.title: Screws are screwed.
customer_reviews.text: Other reviewer were so right. Screws are useless. Mine broke in half going through a pilot hole. Lol. Not to mention stripped at the head. Get your own.
customer_reviews.author: J G

customer_reviews.title: Bad screws!
customer_reviews.text: So many reviews commented on terrible screws. They were terrible. Immediately unable to hold screw driver. Had to find others. Why not fix this small part and make it useful for buyers??
customer_reviews.author: Christine Middleton

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for mounting my bike
customer_reviews.text: Holds up my bike easily and took less then 5 mins to install. If done correctly you won’t strip the screws.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install if you have a good drill. Needs to go on a stud. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Shaul

customer_reviews.title: Good rack!
customer_reviews.text: The worked great for a hanging my 12 speed from the 2x4 garage rafters.
customer_reviews.author: Latman

customer_reviews.title: Good bike rack.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome bike rack, very sturdy. It does come out of the wall probably like 10 inches. Other than that great bike rack
customer_reviews.author: Love Shopping

customer_reviews.title: must have for garage
customer_reviews.text: Great product. easy to use and when not in use just fold up to clear the space.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work good
customer_reviews.text: Holds my bike up, a little bulky when not in use, but it works
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Moser

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Cheap and easy to install. Keeps my bike up and out of the way.
customer_reviews.author: Carley B.

customer_reviews.title: Great, sturdy and quality materials
customer_reviews.text: Great, sturdy and quality materials. It would have been good to have plastic screw chucks included with the screws but overall a good buy that will hold a standard bicycle.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Williams

customer_reviews.title: Good bike hanger
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it says it will do. Very supportive.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer gregm

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Well made. Delivered well packed snd earlier than promised. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: J. Dixon

customer_reviews.title: does the job perfectly - bought 2 to hang up ...
customer_reviews.text: does the job perfectly - bought 2 to hang up both my bikes- still going strong after almost 3 months and saves me space in my garage
customer_reviews.author: Ehidon

customer_reviews.title: It's a stalwart in hanging up bikes
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice, ridiculously easy to install, and made it easy for us to hang up bikes on the porch.
customer_reviews.author: dale kim

customer_reviews.title: I love my bike racks
customer_reviews.text: I put 2 of these in my shed. My son told me about them. They are heavy duty for a. Bike up to 50 pounds. Good seller!
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Bad Supplied Screws!
customer_reviews.text: The wall mount itself seems nicely built but I am unable to mount it since the screws that came with it could not withstand the screwdriver and got stripped ( both of them )! Now i have screws that are half way through sticking from the wall!
customer_reviews.author: Ankush Kaistha

customer_reviews.title: Great Rack but get better screws to hold
customer_reviews.text: Great idea and holds my bikes well. Must agree with other reviewers about the screws provided, they are garbage and strip with little effort.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: Installed this with drop anchors, seems pretty solid and holds a bike just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Dan M.

customer_reviews.title: Minimalist and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with this product. Minimalist and sturdy. My bike looks great hanging up.
customer_reviews.author: Caity Maple

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: It’s easy to install and holds my bike fine. Compare with other brands and options it cost less and that’s why I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to install
customer_reviews.text: This is great for hanging bikes in the garage. Super easy to mount on the wall and holds bikes securely. Nothing fancy but a good deal and a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great so far!
customer_reviews.text: Admittedly, we have not had this for very long, but it is working great! It was easy to install other than just issues finding a good stud in our wall which is not at all this product's fault LOL. Great for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I had zero issues mounting this and it has worked perfectly. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Meagan B.

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: Works as intended. I bought two and stacked them vertically in the corner of my garage. Clears up space and keeps the bikes off the ground. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: KFas

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: only issue is it did not come with hardware, a couple of screws would have made life easier
customer_reviews.author: Ronald H.

customer_reviews.title: Solid hanger
customer_reviews.text: Two screws into the wall stud and that was it. Holds my Trek road bike easily.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty easy to put up
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put up holds bike away from wall so pum etc can go behind
customer_reviews.author: Scott M Soloway

customer_reviews.title: I bought 4 because I like the flip up concept when not in use
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 because I like the flip up concept when not in use. Generally performs well, but the rubber material that is supposed to protect the bike is not very durable and has already torn after just a month of use.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Smith

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, works as expected, made room in my garage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It feels solid and does the job so far...
customer_reviews.text: The screws that come with the rack aren't perfect to go into studs, so you may need self-drilling screws.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel El

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install too
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Easy to install too. Seem very sturdy and it opens up a lot of space in my garage!
customer_reviews.author: Jose C. Hecht

customer_reviews.title: Super affordable and easy design.  Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.text: These are great! I purchased three of them and hung three bikes in my garage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product, be wary of the supplied screws
customer_reviews.text: The product is great and holds my bike perfectly. The screws that it comes with strip very easily and I ended up using bolts instead.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Bike Rack
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up but I had to use my own screw because it felt sturdy and safe. But it’s a perfect space saver in my garage.
customer_reviews.author: Jemie

customer_reviews.title: I think it is much better than many elaborate and more expensive bike
customer_reviews.text: Very simple yet very effective. I think it is much better than many elaborate and more expensive bike mounts
customer_reviews.author: Nitant Sharma

customer_reviews.title: Good value!
customer_reviews.text: Was skeptical but this inexpensive hanger has held up well!
customer_reviews.author: Caroline M

customer_reviews.title: Buy your own screws.
customer_reviews.text: Great bike rack. Don't use the screws that come with bike rack. Also, use a strong drill gun.
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: The ruber protection on the place where holds the bike ...
customer_reviews.text: The ruber protection on the place where holds the bike was out when I got it but still works fine
customer_reviews.author: Wesly Tigre

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: The hardware is cheap. Extremely cheap. I just got the product so we will see if it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap screws
customer_reviews.text: Bike rack is okay. Get new screws. The screws they supply are cheap and the head strips out. Yes, using the right screwdriver they still strip.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install!
customer_reviews.text: This bike rack is so easy to install and holds my bike, no problem. It's a great bike rack and not too big.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Organized garage. I’m!
customer_reviews.text: Quite easy to inspection all and got our bikes out of he way.
customer_reviews.author: monica a. carra

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to strip screw heads
customer_reviews.text: Good product horrible screws. Very easy to strip the screen heads. Just get new ones before you even start.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap screws, don't bother.
customer_reviews.text: Company cheaped out and went with screws that are so low quality the heads will strip. In my guess I had to relocate the rack as it wasn't secure, so has to manually unscrew the screw with vice grips. If that doesn't sound fun to you, look elsewhere for something better quality. .
customer_reviews.author: AlexM

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good quality but I found it for half the cost at Home Depot. It serves its purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Ann.ferr

product_meta.title: Stalwart 75-ST6016 Bike Rack Wall Hook, Wall Mount Flip-Up Bike Storage, Bicycle Holder / Hanger with EVA Foam - Bike Accessories for Garage or House
product_meta.description: Style Name:RegularWhen parking your bike at the end of the season or simply done riding for the day, store your bike effortlessly with the Bike Rack from Stalwart. This sturdy and practical bike hanger truly optimizes your space. Made of solid durable steel with soft EVA foam-coated hooks, Stalwart Bike Wall Mount ensures your bike frame stays safe and secure! NOTE: Maximum weight this device can hold is 50 pounds. To avoid potential damage to your property and avoid personal injury, this hanging device MUST be mounted directly into a wood stud to utilize even the minimum weight capacity it offers. Mounting screws are included. IMPORTANT: Avoid buying counterfeit products and transacting with unauthorized sellers. Look for our logo on the packaging for every one of our products. feature_bullets: STORE YOUR BIKE WITH EASE – When parking your bike at the end of the season or simply done riding for the day, store your bike effortlessly with the Bike Rack from Stalwart. This sturdy and practical bike hanger truly optimizes your space. You can also conveniently fold the bracket up so that it is parallel to the wall and out of your way when not storing a bike on it!

COMPACT, LIGHTWEIGHT DESIGN – Made of solid durable steel with soft EVA foam-coated hooks, Stalwart Bike Wall Mount ensures your bike frame stays safe, secure, and prevents sliding. Suitable for all types of bikes from Mountain bikes, Road bikes, Folding bikes etc.

EASY TO INSTALL – Attach the bicycle mount to a wall stud in your garage wall, at work, or in your house and keep your bike handy and ready to ride. All hardware is included to properly secure your mount and bike to almost any wall.
PRODUCT DETAILS – Dimensions: 13.25 inches (L) x 11.5 inches (W) x 4 inches (H), Weight Capacity of Wall Mount: 50 lbs., Includes 2 Inch Wall Mounting Screws (2 count)

SATISFACTION GUARANTEED – Stalwart is committed to providing consumers with the absolute best price and value on our entire line of products. NOTE: This is an exclusive product of Stalwart and ONLY Bike Rack Wall Hooks by Stalwart are GUARANTEED to be genuine
